text.__SUMMARY__: Campanula scheuchzeri is a species of  bellflower in the family Campanulaceae. The Latin name of the species honors the Swiss botanist Johann Jakob Scheuchzer (1672 – 1733).
text.Description: Campanula scheuchzeri can reach a height of 10–30 centimetres (3.9–11.8 in). It forms solitary blue or purple campanulate flowers. They bloom from July to August.
text.Distribution: This species is native to Iberian Peninsula, France, the Apennine and the Balkan Peninsula, Central Europe and Romania.
text.Habitat: It can be found in mountain regions at an elevation 1,300–2,600 metres (4,300–8,500 ft) above sea level.
text.References:
Christoper Brickell (Editor-in-chief): RHS A-Z Encyclopedia of Garden Plants. Third edition. Dorling Kindersley, London 2003
